name: Gregory POWELL, Petitioner v. The COURT OF COMMON PLEAS OF PHILADELPHIA COUNTY, Respondent
name_abbreviation: Powell v. Court of Common Pleas of Philadelphia County

pin_cites.parenthetical: explaining that hybrid representation is not permitted
explaining that hybrid representation is not permitted

parties: Gregory POWELL, Petitioner v. The COURT OF COMMON PLEAS OF PHILADELPHIA COUNTY, Respondent.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 21st day of December, 2015, the Application for Leave to File Original Process and the Petition for Writ of Mandamus and/or Extraordinary Relief are DISMISSED. See Commonwealth v. Reid, 537 Pa. 167, 642 A.2d 453 (1994) (explaining that hybrid representation is not permitted). The Prothonotary is DIRECTED to forward the filings to counsel of record.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
128 A.3d 1200
Gregory POWELL, Petitioner v. The COURT OF COMMON PLEAS OF PHILADELPHIA COUNTY, Respondent.
No. 128 EM 2015.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Dec. 21, 2015.
